have any of you watched any book-to-movie adaptations recently?â„ï¸â›„ï¸ğŸ„
.
the other night, I finally watched the Netflix adaptation of Let it Snow, and although it was enjoyable, I just felt a bit meh about itğŸ™ I reread Let it Snow almost every single year, and have done for the last 5/6 years. itâ€™s one of my favourite books, so I think because I know the book inside out, I had high expectations for the film. donâ€™t get me wrong, it was super cute and if you havenâ€™t read the book, I donâ€™t think youâ€™d think anything was amiss, but for me, it just wasnâ€™t as quirky or feel as real as the book. 
.
I also watched the Netflix adaptation of Rebecca a few weeks ago, and it was enjoyable, but it just wasnâ€™t as dark as I wanted it to be. the actors just didnâ€™t seem to fit the roles, and I know Iâ€™m not alone in that opinion. if you separate the film from the book, I think itâ€™s quite good, but Iâ€™m not sure if youâ€™re adapting a book, that making the film worse is the goalğŸ˜‚
.
so although Iâ€™ve not had much luck with adaptations recently, itâ€™s still really exciting to see a different take on your favourite books! do any of you have any favourite adaptations? for me, the Perks of Being a Wallflower is a complete standout. and also the 2005 film adaptation of Pride and Prejudice is just beautifulğŸ˜Š
.

Let It Snow 

book review 

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
This was a harmless and a joyful Christmas read! 
I enjoyed all the three stories and I liked how they all collided at the end! 
It was nice that the stories were from teenagers pov so I really could relate to the opinions and feelings.
Overall my favourite story was â€œThe Jubilee Expressâ€ by Maureen Johnson! 
 â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”

ğŸš¨ BOOK REVIEW ğŸš¨

Let It Snow by Maureen Johnson, John Green and Lauren Myracle
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

Honestly, when I started the last story in this collection, I thought it was gonna be downgraded to a 3. I hated everything about Addie and the people around her. But then I realised that was kinda the point, and her journey was actually an enjoyable one, and that ending and the way everything tied back in together definitely brought it back up to a four.

I really enjoyed each of these stories for different reasons. The first was just so funny and so sweet, and the second was such a perfect middle ground with idiot kids being idiots.

I did, however, wanna address the casual use of the word â€œretardedâ€ in story two and â€œspazâ€ in story three. Theyâ€™re very typical of 2008 lingo (i hope to god itâ€™s not typical of todays lingo but I honestly wouldnâ€™t know), but I think itâ€™s important to address that thatâ€™s NOT OKAY. It felt uncomfortable to read and it felt wrong for me to not address it in the review. This book is flawed (for more reasons than just those two words honestly). But I think itâ€™s important to acknowledge flaws in something we enjoy.

â„ï¸ BOOKS ON TOUR â„ï¸

Itâ€™s only September, but it feels like beginning to look a lot like Christmas. Today is my stop and taking part in the #booksontour by @bookandtonic to promote a new release. 

ğŸ“˜Let It Snow by Beth Moran
ğŸ“… 30 August 2022
ğŸ“¸ @bookandtonic 

â€œIâ€™d say that if your family taught me anything, itâ€™s the value of authenticity.â€

First book Iâ€™ve read to begin the countdown until Christmas season. Itâ€™s also the first time Iâ€™m introduced to this book written by Beth Moran. Since this has a family Christmas-y premise, Iâ€™m happy to give myself a try. So, just like the energy and enthusiasm of a kid when it comes to Christmas season, I felt the same excitement to read this book!

Itâ€™s a home-for-the-holidays book that captures the range of emotions tied into saving a familyâ€™s legacy in a small town, being true to yourself, finding your true love and trying to keep a family secret just for the sake to cherish every moment with the family. It was totally hilarious and a fun quick read. There were entertaining family curveballs, which had kept me hooked in the story.

The book also offered a â€œHallmark holiday romanceâ€ vibe. The romance was a slow burn yet heartwarming in the end. The romantic relationship of Bea (a meteorologist) and Henry (an astrophysicist) was charming. I ended up to found myself rooting for both of them. 

Overall, this book could be a good choice for you to escape from the madness of holiday rush or planning during the most wonderful time of the year, Christmas. It is light humor and a feel good book to curl up with a warm blanket and a hot MUG of hot chocolate and lots of toast. Yes! A MUG! Take note of that. Trust me.

âœ¨"Once you think a thought, it is extremely difficult to unthink it."

- Let It Snow

â„ï¸The collection of three short stories in Let It Snow will leave you hankering for more and more.  In other words, this holiday romantic piece is a perfect pick for a wintery read, especially curling up with hot chocolateâ˜ºï¸ (But I read it during good summer daysğŸ˜).

â„ï¸Coming to the novel, it was very-well written and sorted accordingly. It is a lovely story of complete strangers and how their paths cross. Few sequences are so heart-warming, you end up reading again and again. 

â„ï¸I enjoyed reading the stories as the lives of all the characters are entwined beautifully and how they were bought together at the last. 

ğŸŒ¸If you are looking for some light-hearted romance, then this one is for you. It is a fabulous young adult read!!

âœ¨ B O O K â€¢ R E V I E W âœ¨ 

â„ï¸ Let It Snow â„ï¸ - @johngreenwritesbooks @maureenjohnsonbooks @myraclegirl 
â€œThree Holiday Romancesâ€

Itâ€™s Christmas Eve and Gracetown has been buried by snow. But the weather is more than just an inconvenience. When one girl unexpectedly steps off a stranded train, she sets off a series of life-changing events. Soon fourteen pumped-up cheerleaders will descend on the local Waffle House, the Dukeâ€™s DVD night will be rudely interrupted for a Twister mission, and a lovesick barista will determine the fate of a single teacup pig... As the three stories collide, strangers cross paths and romance blossoms with heart-warming consequences.

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ - A lovely holiday romance book. The chapters are somewhat short which helps to keep wanting to read. I love how all the short stories are entwined with each other and this really becomes noticeable at the end of the last story. You really end up rooting for the individual characters and their stories !! Makes for a lovely Young Adult read. 
â€¢

First of allâ€¦this was a fun and easy read! After reading other books with multiple storylines by multiple authors, I wasnâ€™t too sure about it. But, the way these storylines crossed, was pretty impressive. It was always something slight or a minor character from the last section. With that said, there was one story about kids driving in the snow that was harder to connect with. I think I had my mom hat on while reading it. ğŸ˜†

Let it snow - John Green
ğŸ’°IDR 30.000

#jualbukusecond #bukupreloved #jualbukubekas #secondenglishbook #prelovedenglishbooks #jualletitsnow #letitsnowbook #johngreen #readylanjutbaca

[Romance Novel]
Rate - 3.7/5
Price - $16

A Christmas Eve snowstorm transforms one small town into a romantic haven, the kind you see only in movies. Well, kinda. After all, a cold and wet hike from a stranded train through the middle of nowhere would not normally end with a delicious kiss from a charming stranger. And no one would think that a trip to the Waffle House through four feet of snow would lead to love with an old friend. Or that the way back to true love begins with a painfully early morning shift at Starbucks. Thanks to three of todayâ€™s bestselling teen authorsâ€”John Green, Maureen Johnson, and Lauren Myracleâ€”the magic of the holidays shines on these hilarious and charming interconnected tales of love, romance, and breathtaking kisses.

#letitsnow #letitsnowbook #awesomebooksplus

QOTD - When was the last time you saw snow? For me, it's definitely been a couple years since it rarely snows where I live. 

Between Christmas and New Yearâ€™s I picked up this book since I meant to get to it before Christmas (but finals got in the way lol) and I thought it was an okay read. Let it Snow is a collection of three romance short stories by Maureen Johnson, John Green, and Lauren Myracle which all set in the same small town during a snowstorm. Overall I enjoyed how each story tied together, but since every author writes differently I enjoyed some stories more than the others. I loved Maureen Johnsonâ€™s The Jubilee Express which focused on Jubilee who walks off of her train that has stopped during a snowstorm and meets a stranger who she journeys through the snow and eventually falls in love with. I thought Jubilee was a really strong main character and loved her characterization and love story. My least favorite had to be Lauren Myracleâ€™s The Patron Saint of Pigs in part because it focuses on the self centered main character Addie and her quick redemption arc when she picks up her friendâ€™s teacup pig from a local pet store, sacrificing her dignity and comfort along the way. I just found the redemption arc a little bit too rushed and overall didnâ€™t really see it as a romance, although I guess since she ends up with someone at the end of the story and learns to love herself it could be considered one. Overall though, I thought it was a pretty fun read, but didnâ€™t enjoy all of the short stories equally.

Ook al heb ik â€˜let it snowâ€™ niet gelezen, vind ik het wel leuk om hem op mijn feed te showen ;)

Happy Thursday! Have you read any Christmas/holiday books? 

I don't normally, but I saw this at a used bookstore the other day and I finished it on Monday.

I'm currently reading A Sky Beyond the Storm and LOVING it! I'm over 100 pages in, and it is so good! So far, this will be either my fav or second fav in the series.

I made a book inspired recipe yesterday, too! I will be typing it up and posting it sometime after Christmas.

ğŸ„Lets talk about Christmas books! ğŸ„

ğŸ…ğŸ½Whatâ€™s your favorite Christmas book? 

I read Let it Snow in high school and was obsessed with it. So much so that I reread it every year in December for 3 years straight. I loved that it tells 3 different stories but everything comes together in the end. 
(Side note: donâ€™t compare the book to the movie because I only needed to watch the trailer for the movie to know the adaptation was a disappointment ğŸ˜‚ Read the book!) 

Another Christmas book that I wanted to mention is 10 Blind Dates by Ashely Elston. I read this last year and became obsessed. I posted a review about it so I wonâ€™t say much but if youâ€™re looking for a book about nosy family members, blind dates, romance, and one to give you all the Christmas feels...read it because you wonâ€™t be disappointed. â¤ï¸

#christmas #christmasbooks #letitsnowbook #christmasreads #christmasread #bookstagram

Happy Monday! How much reading do you typically get each day? What will you be reading today?

I think usually, when I don't get much reading time, I get 30 minutes to an hour. There are some days I don't read at all, and then when I'm not busy and I spend a lot of the day reading, I read for 4 or 5 hours. 

I started Let It Snow by John Green, Maureen Johnson, and Lauren Myracle last night, and finished the first story, by Maureen Johnson. It was pretty good! I don't usually read holiday books around Christmas time, just continue with whatever fantasy book looks interesting. But I saw it at the used bookstore I went to the other day and decided I'd read it. 

I'm in a bit of a reading slump right now, so it's nice that I've found something enjoying to read.

Have a great day!

â­ï¸â­ï¸ ğŸ„Want to get into the festive mood of Christmas? â„ï¸â˜ƒï¸â„ï¸â˜ƒï¸ You may try this book. I was reading this years ago when I was much younger and figuring out the hype surrounding John Greenâ€™s writing. A young-adult book of three inter-connected holiday romances, I think â€˜Let It Snowâ€™ is generally heart-warming and fits nicely into the genre of hallmark-feel-good vibes of Christmas romances, but thatâ€™s about it. Itâ€™s rather bland and icky for me, and I donâ€™t really like John Green even though I have read a few of his other titles. I tried re-reading this to see how I feel about it now and I still think a 2-star rating is quite a generous one ğŸ˜…. I donâ€™t want to be too much of a grinch about this so I would say I think the book can serve its purpose of getting its target audience into the festive christmassy winter vibes. I also just remembered that Netflix made this into a holiday movie already.
